problem: Solve for the sum of all real values of $x$ such that $\left|{3x - 6}\right| - \left|{x + 2}\right| = 12$.
solution: We need to consider cases based on the values of $3x - 6$ and $x + 2$. Case 1: $3x - 6 \geq 0$ and $x + 2 \geq 0$, then $x \geq 2$ and $x \geq -2$ respectively, thus $x \geq 2$. The equation simplifies to $3x - 6 - (x + 2) = 12 \Rightarrow 2x - 8 = 12 \Rightarrow 2x = 20 \Rightarrow x = 10$. Case 2: $3x - 6 \leq 0$ and $x + 2 \leq 0$, then $x \leq -2$, the equation is $-2x + 8 = 12$, so $x = -2$. Case 3: $3x - 6 < 0$ and $x + 2 > 0$, then $-2 < x < 2$. The equation simplifies to $-(3x - 6) - (x + 2) = 12 \Rightarrow -4x + 4 = 12 \Rightarrow -4x = 8 \Rightarrow x = -2$. Summing the valid $x$ values, $10 + (-2) = \boxed{8}$.
